alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 13 at 6:26AM AKST until November 13 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON FOR WHITTIER... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. West winds gusting 35 to 50 mph. Total snow accumulation of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Whittier. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 4 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Falling and blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will shift to westerly and rapidly strengthen mid to late morning today. This will lead to development of blizzard conditions. Snowfall will end around noon, but winds will continue through the afternoon hours allowing the blizzard conditions and drifting snow to persist.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
